publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-577 Trish Godman: Pen Needles for Diabetics—That the Parliament welcomes the availability of pen needles and the continued availability of disposable pens on prescription for insulin-dependant diabetics; warmly acknowledges the campaign fought by the British Diabetic Association, and commends the Scottish Executive for introducing this policy which will assist thousands of diabetics throughout Scotland in the management of their condition.
S1M-577 Pen Needles for Diabetics (lodged on 22 February 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-577 Trish Godman: Pen Needles for Diabetics—That the Parliament welcomes the availability of pen needles and the continued availability of disposable pens on prescription for insulin-dependant diabetics; warmly acknowledges the campaign fought by the British Diabetic Association, and commends the Scottish Executive for introducing this policy which will assist thousands of diabetics throughout Scotland in the management of their condition. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson
S1M-577 Pen Needles for Diabetics (lodged on 22 February 2000) Michael Russell*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-577 Pen Needles for Diabetics (lodged on 22 February 2000) Elaine Thomson*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Mary Scanlon*

S1M-577 Trish Godman: Pen Needles for Diabetics—That the Parliament welcomes the availability of pen needles and the continued availability of disposable pens on prescription for insulin-dependant diabetics; warmly acknowledges the campaign fought by the British Diabetic Association, and commends the Scottish Executive for introducing this policy which will assist thousands of diabetics throughout Scotland in the management of their condition. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Elaine Thomson, Dr Elaine Murray, Mary Scanlon, Elaine Smith*
S1M-577 Pen Needles for Diabetics (lodged on 22 February 2000) Rhoda Grant*
S1M-577 Pen Needles for Diabetics (lodged on 22 February 2000) Margaret Jamieson*, Robert Brown*
S1M-577 Pen Needles for Diabetics (lodged on 22 February 2000) Cathy Peattie*, Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-577 Trish Godman: Pen Needles for Diabetics—That the Parliament welcomes the availability of pen needles and the continued availability of disposable pens on prescription for insulin-dependant diabetics; warmly acknowledges the campaign fought by the British Diabetic Association, and commends the Scottish Executive for introducing this policy which will assist thousands of diabetics throughout Scotland in the management of their condition. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Elaine Thomson, Dr Elaine Murray, Mary Scanlon, Elaine Smith, Rhoda Grant, Margaret Jamieson, Robert Brown, Cathy Peattie, Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil*
S1M-577 Pen Needles for Diabetics (lodged on 22 February 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Mr David Davidson*
S1M-577 Pen Needles for Diabetics (lodged on 22 February 2000) Fergus Ewing*

S1M-577 Trish Godman: Pen Needles for Diabetics—That the Parliament welcomes the availability of pen needles and the continued availability of disposable pens on prescription for insulin-dependant diabetics; warmly acknowledges the campaign fought by the British Diabetic Association, and commends the Scottish Executive for introducing this policy which will assist thousands of diabetics throughout Scotland in the management of their condition. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Elaine Thomson, Dr Elaine Murray, Mary Scanlon, Elaine Smith, Rhoda Grant, Margaret Jamieson, Robert Brown, Cathy Peattie, Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Mr David Davidson, Fergus Ewing

Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Elaine Thomson, Dr Elaine Murray, Mary Scanlon, Elaine Smith, Rhoda Grant, Margaret Jamieson, Robert Brown, Cathy Peattie, Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Mr David Davidson, Fergus Ewing, Dr Richard Simpson, Cathy Jamieson

S1M-577 Trish Godman: Pen Needles for Diabetics—That the Parliament welcomes the availability of pen needles and the continued availability of disposable pens on prescription for insulin-dependant diabetics; warmly acknowledges the campaign fought by the British Diabetic Association, and commends the Scottish Executive for introducing this policy which will assist thousands of diabetics throughout Scotland in the management of their condition.
